body:
SILVER SPRING, Md. Hillary Clinton said on Thursday she had asked the country's largest labor union federation, the AFL-CIO, to "be my partner" as she seeks the Democratic nomination for the 2016 U.S. presidential election.
After meeting with union leaders, Clinton said she wants the Obama administration's proposed Pacific trade deal to meet tests on worker protection and higher wages.    

 (Reporting by Megan Cassella; Editing by Alistair Bell and Sandra Maler)
description: SILVER SPRING, Md. (Reuters) - Hillary Clinton said on Thursday she had asked the country's largest labor union federation, the AFL-CIO, to "be my partner" as she seeks the Democratic nomination for the 2016 U.S. presidential election.
title: Clinton asks union group to 'be my partner' in White House bid
